result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony L Kuhagen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Total costs and fines to be payed by August 1st, 2016.  Failure to pay will result in one day jail for each $25 owed for contempt of court.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08
Defendant to submit a DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Order to revoke huber privileges
Petition & Proposed Order to Revoke Huber Privileges. Scanned/Forwarded to Branch 1 clerk.
Amended Judgment prepared to include huber privileges that were omitted on prior Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Anthony L Kuhagen in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits plea questionnaire and waiver.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Defendant enters a guilty plea.  Court accepts the plea, finding it to be free and voluntary.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court renders judgment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony L Kuhagen in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 11, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony L Kuhagen in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Defendant Anthony L Kuhagen in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters not guilty plea preserving jurisdictional objections. Atty. Tanz requests motion date, motion to be filed by 1/1/2016. Court orders $500 signature bond w/conditions.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court.  Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court is informed defendant is in custody in Milwaukee County Jail, will be released by 12/16/2015 court date.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance at 11-19-2015 10:00 am

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Tanz appears for defendant. Defendant is in custody at Milwaukee County Jail and clerk could not get defendant on video this morning.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Video conference scheduled for 10:30 am on 9/28. This is the time available at the Milwaukee County Jail. Clerk emailed with officer at Milwaukee County Jail.
Ozaukee Sheriff's Dept notified
Hearing at 09-28-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Anthony L Kuhagen in court, in custody.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears by video from the Milwaukee County Jail. Court informs defendant to contact the public defender to obtain an evaluation. Defendant informs the Court that he will be released from Milwaukee County Jail sometime before Christmas. If defendant is eligible for the public defender, they will notify if order to produce is needed, otherwise video conference. Court orders warrant withdrawn.  Hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 10:00 am.

On request of defendant, case set for 8/12/2015 at 11:15 am for warrant return. Copy of court notice to public defender. Clerk made arrangements for defendant appear by video from Milwaukee County Jail. Copy of defendant's letter forwarded to DA/Public Defender.
